item.description:
The summer series at the WH Main Library focuses on the War of Northern Aggression, also called The War Between the States or the American Civil War. Each Thursday in July view a different movie.

JULY 15 - ANDERSONVILLE 2hrs. 48min.
Jarrod Emick, Frederic Forrest, Cliff DeYoung, William H. Macy, Justin Henry, Jan Triska; Directed by John Frankenheimer
Not Rated; 1996 - Andersonville was the crude, open-air prison stockade where Union captives waited out the Civil War, exposed to the elements, overcrowding and staggering deprivation. In 1864 and 1865, more than 45,000 Union soldiers were imprisoned in Andersonville, of whom almost 13,000 died - more than 100 a day during that summer. David W. Rintelsâ€™ story, as seen through the eyes of young soldier Josiah Day Jarrod (Emick). Winner of an Emmy for director John Frankenheimer.


All films start at 5:15PM sharp in the Library Meeting Room, Noah Webster Library, 20 S. Main St.
Park in the Isham Garage and bring your parking ticket to the library for validation.
Enjoy the films with your own covered beverage or quiet snack.
Note that the movie may not take up the entire assigned time. We can go out after the movie, many restaurants in the area will be open afterwards.
COST: FREE

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: WH Library Summer Series - CIVIL WAR - Andersonville
